page.title: 10Toppesfield Stores
page.content: Toppesfield Stores was originally built as a farmhouse about 1680 and is protected as a Grade II "listed" building.Although now a general store, it was once used as a bakery and previously as a butcher'shop.The village once had two other shops but these have long since closed. Mr.& Mrs.Shannon,the present owners, have been there for 20 years.When they first came,the shop was extensively used by local people and the many farm workers who were employed pea and potato picking.Now the shop is mainly used for convenience shopping because most families have cars and go to supermarkets in nearby towns for their main food needs. Mr.Shannon has long been interested in old furniture and has developed his hobby into an exten_ sion of the business so that part of the shop is now used for antique sales
